alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:52PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON...SOUTHWESTERN NEMAHA AND NORTHEASTERN PAWNEE COUNTIES... At 452 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located over Table Rock, or 5 miles northeast of Pawnee City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Johnson, southwestern Nemaha and northeastern Pawnee Counties. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
